<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inlinespiller-cpp-/hoistspillhelper"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inlinespiller-cpp-/hoistspillhelper/#a9060125be37c7bf45b516967b013f94c">HoistSpillHelper</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverangeedit/delegate">LiveRangeEdit::Delegate</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertpointanalysis">InsertPointAnalysis</a> IPA;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Map from StackSlot to the LiveInterval of the original register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note the LiveInterval of the original register may have been deleted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// after it is spilled. We keep a copy here to track the range where</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// spills can be moved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;int, std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;LiveInterval&gt;</a>&gt; StackSlotToOrigLI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Map from pair of (StackSlot and Original VNI) to a set of spills which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have the same stackslot and have equal values defined by Original VNI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These spills are mergeable and are hoist candidates.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">MergeableSpillsMap =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mapvector">MapVector&lt;std::pair&lt;int, VNInfo &#42;&gt;</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, 16&gt;</a>&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal">  MergeableSpillsMap MergeableSpills;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is the map from original register to a set containing all its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// siblings. To hoist a spill to another BB, we need to find out a live</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sibling there and use it as the source of the new spill.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When spilling a virtual register, we also spill any snippets it is connected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to. The snippets are small live ranges that only have a single real use,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// leftovers from live range splitting. Spilling them enables memory operand</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// folding or tightens the live range around the single use.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This minimizes register pressure and maximizes the store-to-load distance for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// spill slots which can be important in tight loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">/// isFullCopyOf - If MI is a COPY to or from Reg, return the other register,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">/// otherwise return 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">/// isSnippet - Identify if a live interval is a snippet that should be spilled.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is assumed that SnipLI is a virtual register with the same original as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Edit-&gt;getReg().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> InlineSpiller::isSnippet(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &amp;SnipLI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A snippet is a tiny live range with only a single instruction using it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// besides copies to/from Reg or spills/fills.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Exception is done for statepoint instructions which will fold fills</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into their operands.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We accept:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %snip = COPY %Reg / FILL fi#</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %snip = USE %snip</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %snip = STATEPOINT %snip in var arg area</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %Reg = COPY %snip / SPILL %snip, fi#</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!LIS.intervalIsInOneMBB(SnipLI))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// statepoint instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is beneficial to spill to earlier place in the same BB in case</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There is an alternative def earlier in the same MBB.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Hoist the spill as far as possible in SpillMBB. This can ease</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="comment">/// register pressure:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="comment">///   x = def</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="comment">///   y = use x</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="comment">///   s = copy x</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Hoisting the spill of s to immediately after the def removes the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="comment">/// interference between x and y:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="comment">///   x = def</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="comment">///   spill x</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="comment">///   y = use killed x</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This hoist only helps when the copy kills its source.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> InlineSpiller::canGuaranteeAssignmentAfterRemat(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> VReg,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="#aa6d594f20f477b54afc0381268ddd347">RestrictStatepointRemat</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here&#39;s a quick explanation of the problem we&#39;re trying to handle here:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42; There are some pseudo instructions with more vreg uses than there are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   physical registers on the machine.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42; This is normally handled by spilling the vreg, and folding the reload</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   into the user instruction.  (Thus decreasing the number of used vregs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   until the remainder can be assigned to physregs.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42; However, since we may try to spill vregs in any order, we can end up</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   trying to spill each operand to the instruction, and then rematting it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   instead.  When that happens, the new live intervals (for the remats) are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   expected to be trivially assignable (i.e. RS&#95;Done).  However, since we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   may have more remats than physregs, we&#39;re guaranteed to fail to assign</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// At the moment, we only handle this for STATEPOINTs since they&#39;re the only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pseudo op where we&#39;ve seen this.  If we start seeing other instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the same problem, we need to revisit this.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOpcode() != TargetOpcode::STATEPOINT)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For STATEPOINTs we allow re-materialization for fixed arguments only hoping</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that number of physical registers is enough to cover all fixed arguments.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If it is not true we need to revisit it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/statepointopers">StatepointOpers</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>).getVarIdx(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal">                EndIdx = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getNumOperands();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal">       Idx &lt; EndIdx; ++Idx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp;MO = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOperand(Idx);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MO.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#a4c9594c955fec80c73ddd964b5efd554">isReg</a>() &amp;&amp; MO.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand/#ac0035d7c1c860501c877c20e6e93297b">getReg</a>() == VReg)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1400"><Highlight kind="normal">    Spills.erase(SpillToRm);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1402"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Starting from \\p Root find a top-down traversal order of the dominator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><Highlight kind="comment">/// tree to visit all basic blocks containing the elements of \\p Spills.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1405"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Redundant spills will be found and put into \\p SpillsToRm at the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1406"><Highlight kind="comment">/// time. \\p SpillBBToSpill will be populated as part of the process and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><Highlight kind="comment">/// maps a basic block to the first store occurring in the basic block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1408"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\post SpillsToRm.union(Spills\\@post) == Spills\\@pre</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HoistSpillHelper::getVisitOrders(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;Root, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, 16&gt;</a> &amp;Spills,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Orders,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;SpillsToRm,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1414"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;, MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;SpillBBToSpill) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The set contains all the possible BB nodes to which we may hoist</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1416"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// original spills.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1417"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;, 8&gt;</a> WorkSet;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1418"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Save the BB nodes on the path from the first BB node containing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-redundant spill to the Root node.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1420"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;, 8&gt;</a> NodesOnPath;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1421"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// All the spills to be hoisted must originate from a single def instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to the OrigReg. It means the def instruction should dominate all the spills</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be hoisted. We choose the BB where the def instruction is located as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the Root.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a94b65b831ad8756f7d3a029a1e599f75">MachineDomTreeNode</a> &#42;RootIDomNode = MDT&#91;Root&#93;-&gt;getIDom();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For every node on the dominator tree with spill, walk up on the dominator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tree towards the Root node until it is reached. If there is other node</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// containing spill in the middle of the path, the previous spill saw will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be redundant and the node containing it will be removed. All the nodes on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the path starting from the first node with non-redundant spill to the Root</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1431"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// node will be added to the WorkSet, which will contain all the possible</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1432"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// locations where spills may be hoisted to after the loop below is done.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1433"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Spill : Spills) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1498"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Visit order of dominator tree nodes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1499"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;, 32&gt;</a> Orders;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1500"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SpillsToKeep contains all the nodes where spills are to be inserted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1501"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// during hoisting. If the spill to be inserted is an original spill</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1502"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (not a hoisted one), the value of the map entry is 0 If the spill</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineDomTreeNode &#42;, MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> SpillBBToSpill;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For spills with equal values, remove redundant spills and hoist those left</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to less hot spots.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1615"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Spills with equal values will be collected into the same set in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1616"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MergeableSpills when spill is inserted. These equal spills are originated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from the same defining instruction and are dominated by the instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1618"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Before hoisting all the equal spills, redundant spills inside in the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1619"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BB are first marked to be deleted. Then starting from the spills left, walk</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1620"><Highlight kind="comment">/// up on the dominator tree towards the Root node where the define instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1621"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is located, mark the dominated spills to be deleted along the way and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1622"><Highlight kind="comment">/// collect the BB nodes on the path from non-dominated spills to the define</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1623"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction into a WorkSet. The nodes in WorkSet are the candidate places</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1624"><Highlight kind="comment">/// where we are considering to hoist the spills. We iterate the WorkSet in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1625"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bottom-up order, and for each node, we will decide whether to hoist spills</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1626"><Highlight kind="comment">/// inside its subtree to that node. In this way, we can get benefit locally</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1627"><Highlight kind="comment">/// even if hoisting all the equal spills to one cold place is impossible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1628" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inlinespiller-cpp-/hoistspillhelper/#a597bb5d7ef9a22f44dbe867d8eaa7fd6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inlinespiller-cpp-/hoistspillhelper/#a597bb5d7ef9a22f44dbe867d8eaa7fd6">HoistSpillHelper::hoistAllSpills</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1629"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Register, 4&gt;</a> NewVRegs;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1631"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1632"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0, e = MRI.getNumVirtRegs(); i != e; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
